author: Mike Cabrey
text: It was a golden day for Hatboro-Horsham’s Annie Jia Wednesday at the PIAA Class 3A Swimming Championships, the junior winning both the 200 individual medley and 100 butterfly — setting a PIAA record in the later — and helping the Hatters win in the 200 free relay. North Penn’s Maddie Faikish also claimed gold in the 200 free at Bucknell University’s Kinney Natatorium while the Upper Dublin took first place in the girls 200 medley relay. Jia broke her own PIAA record in winning the 100 fly, her time of 51.26 besting the 52.04 she swam as a freshman in 2022. UD’s Olivia Auwarter earned a spot on the medal stand in the event by taking eighth in 57.14. In the 200 IM, Jia — a Cal commit — won with a NFHS Honor Roll time of 1:58.19. Auwarter came in fifth at 2:04.18, North Penn’s Emma Raser was sixth (2:05.61) with Souderton’s Jessica Burns taking seventh (2:06.42). Jia capped off Wednesday by swimming a 22.25 on the lead leg in Hatboro-Horsham’s winning 200 free relay, joining Eloise Mothersbaugh (22.50), Emmy Erikson (23.96) and Sarah Parker (22.30) to finish in a NFHS Honor Roll time of 1:33.51. Upper Dublin was fourth in the 200 free relay, the Cards’ foursome of Arina Vorobyeva, Maddie Shapiro, Sophia Sileo-Magliari and Alicia Taylor posting a time of 1:36.31. Faikish set a North Penn school record in winning the 200 freestyle with a time 1:48.65. The state gold is the second for the junior after taking first in last year’s 500 free. Vorobyeva was second to Faikish in 1:49.51 while Methacton’s Madison Wimmer (1:51.17) and Wissahickon’s Nora Weber (1:51.62) were fourth and fifth, respectively. Erikson gave the Hatters an eight-place finish in 1:54.80. In the 200 medley relay, Upper Dublin’s Vikki Williams (26.05), Sileo-Magliari (28.49), Auwarter (25.36) and Shapiro (23.42) captured gold with an NFHS Honor Roll time of 1:43.32. North Penn’s quartet of Ruth Kim, Zoe Welsh, Mikayla Potts and Sara Poach were seventh in the event in 1:43.32. In the boys’ portion of states Wednesday, Central Bucks West’s Blaise Hofmann and Jimin Chung earned second and third, respectively, the 200 IM while it was silver-medal efforts for both Plymouth Whitemarsh’s Brennan Coyle in the 100 fly and North Penn’s 200 medley relay. North Penn also picked up a pair of medals in diving as Joshua Gratton earned fourth place with 406.20 points and David Dian just behind in fifth at 401.10. Hofmann, a junior, swam a 1:49:87 in the 200 IM, an effort only bettered by Conestoga’s Jake Wang, who won with a NFHS Honor Roll time of 1:44.20. Sophomore Chung gave the Bucks bronze as he hit the wall in 1:52.98. Coyle earned second in the 100 fly with his NFHS Honor Roll finish of 47.57. North Penn’s Mason Potts posted a 48.90 to take fourth while Souderton’s Ryan Christie earned eighth with a time of 50.81. CB West’s Derek Feldman finish fourth in the 50 free with a time of 20. 64. In the 200 free, La Salle’s Cole Faikish came in sixth (1:40.42) with West’s Connor Mangan placing eighth in 1:41.07. North Penn and CB West both recorded NFHS Honor Roll times in the 200 medley relay — the Knights setting a team record in taking second in 1:31.09 with the Bucks placing third in 1:30.04. Springfield-Delco won in a time of 1:30.04. La Salle earned seventh in 1:34.12. La Salle collected bronze in the 200 free relay, the Explorers (1:24.22) finishing behind winner Conestoga (1:22.03) and Springfield (1:22:28). North Penn was fifth in the event in 1:24.93. The PIAA Class 3A Championships conclude Thursday with the 2A Championships held Friday and Saturday at Bucknell.
